intro: Phyllanthus bernierianus, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, often hairy stems. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a distinctive waxy coating. Phyllanthus bernierianus is adapted to various soil types and can thrive in both sunny and partially shaded environments.
